intro: Brodiaea peduncularis, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, leafless stems that bear small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, round bulbs that serve as storage organs and aid in its survival during dry periods. Brodiaea peduncularis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
